abstract: National Yiddish Theater Folksbiene presents operetta Di Goldene Kale (The Golden Bride), product of painstaking reconstruction that began with discovery of its lead sheet in 1983; Yiddish-language work, composed by Joseph Rumshinsky with libretto by Frieda Freiman, premiered favorably in 1923 but slipped into obscurity due to unfortunate events and policies impacting Jewish community.
lead_paragraph: After a reconstruction decades in the making, this Yiddish-language operetta, which was a hit when it had its premiere in 1923, is about to have its first fully staged production.

headline.main: Preparing ‘The Golden Bride’ for Its Big Day
headline.print_headline: ‘Golden Bride’ Has Made a Long March to Its Big Day

snippet: After a reconstruction decades in the making, this Yiddish-language operetta, which was a hit when it had its premiere in 1923, is about to have its first fully staged production.
